message.content:
cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.LO

Reasoning: 
1. cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) - The paper deals with automata and their state complexity, which is a core topic in formal languages and automata theory.
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The study of numeration systems and their representations of numbers involves algorithms and data structures, which are important topics in this sub-category.
3. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The state complexity of automata is a measure of computational complexity, and this sub-category deals with the study of complexity classes and their relationships.
4. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper involves the study of numeration systems and their representations of numbers, which can be seen as a form of information encoding. This sub-category deals with the study of information theory and its applications.
5. cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) - The study of automata and their state complexity involves logic and formal reasoning, which are important topics in this sub-category.
